entry.title: Re: Fiori Elements Excel Export with Header and Footer
entry.content:
Hi Ben,

Fiori Elements standard Excel export does not support headers/footers like what you saw ALV does by default.

How about below approach?
override the default export behavior using a custom button in your Fiori Elements app (via custom action or extension point) and implement logic like below:-
(let us use the master in downloadable Excel Reports: SheetJS)
-download minified version from "https://github.com/SheetJS/sheetjs"
-Place it in your SAPUI5 project under webapp/lib/xlsx/
-include in Component.js using below snippet:-
 

// Load SheetJS dynamically
  const loadSheetJS = function () {
    const sScriptPath = jQuery.sap.getModulePath("your.namespace") + "/lib/xlsx/xlsx.full.min.js";
    jQuery.sap.includeScript(sScriptPath);
  };

then for your custom action button event Ben,

onExportCustomExcel: function () {
  const oTable = this.byId("yourTableId");
  const aData = oTable.getBinding("items").getContexts().map(ctx => ctx.getObject());

  const header = [["Company Code: 1234"], ["Report Title: Stock Overview"], []];
  const footer = [[""], ["Printed On: 31.07.2025", "Printed By: Arun", "Page: 1"]];

  const wsData = [...header, ...aData.map(obj => [obj.Field1, obj.Field2, ...]), ...footer];

  const ws = XLSX.utils.aoa_to_sheet(wsData);
  const wb = XLSX.utils.book_new();
  XLSX.utils.book_append_sheet(wb, ws, "Report");
  XLSX.writeFile(wb, "Report.xlsx");
}

entry.content:
Hi,

It looks like you've tried to preview the code you've written so far, but the goal here is to create a working SAPUI5/Fiori application. This requires a specific folder structure—typically, all web development components (such as your index.html file) should reside within the webapp folder. The preview functionality is generally available when you right-click the webapp folder in your project.

You might find the following tutorial helpful to get started. For a basic setup, you can select "None" as the data source to begin with an empty template.

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 亮点前瞻：人工智能Artificial Intelligence
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Cloud公共版2508版本新增了多项AI功能，通过自动化、智能分析和自然语言处理，显著提高企业的运营效率。这些更新重点聚焦在提升用户体验、实现流程自动化、获取深度业务洞察，以及优化现有功能上，旨在提高工作效率和准确性。

提示:

  • 使用SAP S/4HANA Cloud公共版中的部分生成式AI功能可能需要额外的授权和权限。有关AI功能使用的商务问题，请您咨询你的SAP客户经理。
  • 以下AI功能尚未在中国大陆地区上线，建议您咨询您的SAP客户经理以获取最新的信息。

以下是SAP S/4HANA Cloud公共版 2508版本中新增的一些主要AI功能及其介绍：

用户体验中的AI 创新：

AI辅助企业搜索 (AI-Assisted Enterprise Search)​​

  • ​​功能​​：用户现可直接在SAP Fiori Launchpad搜索栏中使用自然语言搜索业务对象。搜索结果基于AI生成的筛选条件生成，您可随时通过 ​​“AI解释”按钮​​查看筛选条件的逻辑。启用此功能需在用户档案设置中勾选 ​​“启用AI自然语言搜索”​​。
  • ​​效率提升​​：该功能使业务数据查找过程更直观高效，显著优于传统关键词搜索或复杂筛选设置，大幅提升信息获取效率。

点击图片查看视频

同时，近期推出的三项AI辅助用户体验创新功能—企业搜索(enterprise search)​​、​​轻松过滤器(easy filter)​​ 和​​智能总结(smart summarization)​​—现已在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中免费使用。您只需接受 ​​SAP AI使用条款​​，SAP将会为您的租户启用这些功能，即刻体验更直观的交互操作、更快的洞察速度及更高的生产效率。

更多的AI辅助功能介绍（如轻松过滤器、智能总结），请参考往期博客 。

Joule for Business

虽然 SAP Joule 的发布周期与 SAP S/4HANA Cloud 公共版有所不同，但在2025年在以下的三个领域实现了突破性的增强。

  1. ​​实时业务对象洞察​​
    • 直接通过自然语言指令查看​​34类业务对象​​详情，覆盖采购/销售/生产订单等核心模块（如显示逾期采购订单项）
  2. ​​跨模块事务处理​​
    • ​​财务领域​​：对话式创建固定资产（输入：公司代码+资产类别+成本中心）
    • ​​销售领域​​：
      ✓ 动态管理到期价格（延长有效期并调整金额）
      ✓ 实时诊断销售订单阻塞问题（如信用冻结/数据缺失）
    • ​​一键生成洞察卡​​：将查询结果保存至"我的主页"（支持采购/销售订单等应用）

详细内容，请移步Joule功能全景介绍：Joule在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition... - SAP Community。

财务中的AI创新

财务业务洞察的快捷操作(Business Insights Quick Actions)

集团财务报表审阅手册 (Group Financial Statements Review Booklet)

    • 经过2502版本的beta测试后，集团财务报表审阅手册中预定义的AI辅助业务洞察功能——即快捷操作（Quick Action）——现已在最近版本中全面上线。用户可通过该功能快速生成数据分析和摘要。这些智能分析包括损益（按费用性质）、底线增长、EBIT、EBITDA、财务结果、营业收入/亏损、盈利能力、顶线增长和货币差异等。

这些洞察通过以自然语言分析突出关键数字、差异和相关背景，帮助简化财务审阅流程。    

目前您还可以在财务洞察审阅手册中使用以下预定义的AI辅助业务洞察功能：成本中心审阅手册 (Cost Centers Review Booklet)

此功能在2502发布，可以帮助您发现成本中心审查手册中的数据意义、突出数据之间的依赖关系，利用自然语言快速解释和汇总洞察，并建议相应的操作。详情请见往期博客

AI辅助解释固定资产关键指标 (AI-assisted explanation of fixed asset key figures)

    • 功能: 本功能基于SAP Business AI深度解析固定资产关键指标的计算逻辑，通过自然语言以通俗易懂的方式，向用户解释系统计算固定资产价值的过程。详细解释固定资产关键指标（如折旧和账面净值）的计算来源和构成。例如，它能详细说明在年中购置后，使用特定折旧码时，折旧值是如何计算的。

    • 效率提升: 这项功能能够显著减少理解固定资产计算所需的时间，帮助用户更好地理解复杂的资产估值细节，并确定为何会发生意外的价值变化（例如，意外过账的特殊折旧）。通过更轻松地理解资产和折旧值，提高了业务用户的生产力。它简化了解释过程，让用户能更快地掌握财务数据和价值变化，从而提升效率并支持更好的决策制定。

生成式AI创建固定资产主数据 (Generative AI capability: creating fixed asset master data)

    • 功能: 用户可通过与Joule对话，直接创建固定资产主数据（如创建笔记本电脑资产）, 从而减少错误并确保更高的数据准确性和更好的数据治理。

    • 效率提升: 它能够减少创建资产主数据所需的时间和精力，相比通过复杂的传统SAP Fiori应用程序进行导航更为高效。同时，通过对话式数据输入流程，减少了错误并确保了更高的数据准确性和更好的数据治理。此外，还能减少大规模培训时间并加快最终用户入职，通过允许用户在对话中快速输入和管理数据来提高业务用户的工作效率和满意度。

您可以查看这条视频了解更多内容Simplify Asset Accounting with SAP Business AI and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

风险管理中的AI创新

  1. AI辅助的贸易分类建议与模糊搜索 (AI-assisted trade classification proposals with fuzzy search)
    • 功能: 从SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508版本开始，系统将通过使用SAP HANA模糊搜索技术，根据现有产品分类的相似性搜索，为产品分配海关关税号和商品代码的贸易分类建议。系统会根据产品描述的比较生成匹配列表和估计准确度的分数。
    • 效率提升: 贸易分类可能复杂且耗时，此功能自动化并加速了这一过程，通过根据已有的贸易产品分类提供准确的分类建议，减少了手动工作量和潜在错误。提高了贸易分类专家的生产力。

质量管理中的AI创新

SAP Document AI辅助处理入库质量证书 (AI-Assisted Processing of Incoming Quality Certificates with SAP Document AI)

    • 功能: 此功能能够自动处理入库质量证书文件。SAP Document AI提取质量证书数据，并尽可能自动将证书附加到相关的证书收据，或者在没有匹配收据的情况下创建新的收据。如果系统无法明确识别或更新收据，用户可以在新的“审查证书文档匹配”应用程序中查看提取的数据并手动完成匹配。这是一个全自动化的流程，显著减少了手动输入和人为错误。此功能无需定制开发，可立即为客户带来价值。
    • 效率提升: 通过自动化处理，它显著减少了手动输入和人为错误，从而更高效地处理证书，确保信息不丢失或被忽略。质量技术人员被解放出来，可以专注于更具战略性和增值性的活动。这也能实现更快的库存发布，减少与检查相关的生产延误，并全面提高吞吐量。

可扩展性AI助手 (Extensibility AI Assistant)

    • 功能: 这是一个由生成式AI驱动的助手。在“自定义字段”应用程序中，它能帮助您完成与字段可扩展性相关的各种任务，例如创建自定义字段、查找业务上下文、用法、值帮助视图和启用业务场景。在“自定义逻辑”应用程序中，该助手还可以根据您的自然语言输入来查找BAdI（业务附加项）。它通过智能的用法分析增强了透明度，支持更好的治理和更高效的变更管理。
    • 效率提升: 您只需用日常语言描述需求，AI就能自动查找和创建所需内容。这将极大地减少手动配置和探索的时间，让字段扩展和BAdI查找任务变得前所未有的快速和高效。它还能帮助自定义字段与底层业务流程保持一致，提高系统行为的一致性和相关性。

 

详细请参考博客

 管理本地化表单模板(Manage Localized Form Templates)

此功能在2502版本中发布, 您可以在此应用程序中，通过自然语言描述来对SAP发布的本地化表单模板进行扩展。在2508版本中，在“管理本地化表单模板”应用的表单生成屏幕中添加了提示词（prompt）历史记录部分。您可以通过查看提示历史记录中的提示词来检查对表单模板扩展执行过哪些操作。

以上这篇文章希望可以帮助您更好地理解SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中AI创新功能及其在2508版本的最新发布资讯。

有关 SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 版本交付内容的更多详细信息，请参阅

Watch the replays of our exclusive SAP S/4HANA Clo... - SAP Community 

感谢阅读。

entry.title: Re: How to Integrate E-Invoice India in sap public cloud...
entry.content:
Providing step by step configuration is definitely a challenge for anybody. You need to start from somewhere based on the blog.

The integrations steps are clearly mentioned in the blog. In fact, under the heading Implementation steps, it is clearly mentioned what should be activated, which is 'Scope Item 5XU – SAP Document and Reporting Compliance'. Ensure, your third-party provider supports integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud (e.g., via PEPPOL, GSTN, PAC, etc.). Have access to SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) and SAP Integration Suite.

Then comes to Architecture setup, it is also mentioned in the blog clearly that you need to set up middleware (SAP BTP or third-party) to act as a bridge between SAP and tax authorities. Deploy Integration Flows (iFlows) in SAP Integration Suite for your country-specific e-invoicing scenario and activate Communication Arrangements in SAP S/4HANA Cloud to enable data exchange.

Activate Document and Reporting Compliance Features via CBC or Solution Builder. Use the app Manage Your Solution to access configuration activities.

If you go through the header Maintaining value mappings, in the blog, it is stated that you need to use the Configure Value Mapping app to map internal SAP values to external codes required by the tax authority or third-party provider. The related examples are also given. 

Also in the blog, SAP's Help documentations are shared where couple of SAP notes are referred.  Go through all those SAP notes.

With all the above information, you and your team have to start from scratch, no doubt, you will face en-number of issues. Post here with the related screen shot, so that the members will assist you

entry.title: Re: Transport process of BPA, BAS and IS projects in BTP
entry.content:
Hello Aye,

For your question about your account structure, I recommend to take a look at Setting Up Your Account Model | SAP Help Portal in the SAP BTP Administrator's Guide.

The recommended way for the transport would be to use SAP Cloud Transport Management service to handle the transport of your content types. For this, you subscribe to the service on a shared/central subaccount (you normally only need one instance of SAP Cloud Transport Management in your landscape) and set up transport landscapes for your different use cases - that is, one for SAP Build Process Automation, one for your SAPUI5 app, one for SAP Integration Suite. The actual configuration differs slightly depending on content type, as there are different options on how to integrate. You can find more information here: Supported Content Types | SAP Help Portal (follow the "more information" links for the relevant content types).

One remark for SAPUI5: there is no direct integration from SAP Business Application Studio to SAP Cloud Transport Management. I recommend that you connect your project in SAP Business Application Studio to a Git repository and then set up a very simple build pipeline in SAP Continuous Integration and Delivery service and connect it to your Git. This is really simple and can be done in minutes. When you then submit changes to your Git repo, this would automatically trigger a build of your project and could also automatically create a transport in SAP Cloud Transport Management - for example, every time you submit changes to your main branch in Git. For example, check out this video about SAP Continuous Integration and Delivery to learn more: SAP BTP DevOps: SAP Continuous Integration and Delivery service

I hope this helps!

Best regards,
Boris

entry.title: Re: i have issue while migrating WebIDE project to BAS - BTP
entry.content:
You have to migrate the SAPUI5 version.  1.30.0 is quite old already and not available in SAP CDN for a very long time. This can explain the blank screen if you see the 'sap-ui-core.js' file is not loaded when running the app.

It's not clear how you are migrating the apps,  but there is a WebIDE / BAS integration that does that for you. In my experience, this migration tool is very limited.

My recommendation would be to create an empty project in BAS from a template and see the file structure of the app, specially in the root folder but not only it. Make sure your app being migrated have every file the app from template has. Mainly:

  • ui5*.yaml files (default runner, local, mock, deploy(
  • package.json dependencies and scripts
  • manifest.json schema/versions
  • SAPUI5 versions wherever they appear (ui5*.yaml, package.json, index.html, etc) 
    • If you deploy work app in BTP, consider adding the extra sap.platform.cf
  • You can even delete some files from the test folder by using virtual endpoints
  • linter files
  • .gitignore
  • BTP specific files (xs-app, xs-security)
  • mta.yaml structure, modules and service instances

Hope that helps!

entry.title: Re: Growth Rebate in Condition Contract
entry.content:
Hello,

This scenario is possible in theory. To achieve this, you need to use additional business volume tables. In the additional business volume tables there is a setting to select the previous year business volume (Business Volume Period Selection). There is another setting where you can transfer this business volume to a dedicated condition type (totals only). Afterwards, once you have the business volume of the current and previous years, you can write calculation routines to get the delta and perform the calculations of the rebate on the incremental sales YoY.

Thanks

entry.title: Navigating SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Greenfield Implementations: Lessons Learned from the Frontlines
entry.content:
1. SAP Best Practices

Accelerate with a Solid Foundation. SAP Best Practices are pre-configured business processes, tested and fine-tuned for most industries. Starting with these:

Accelerates Blueprinting: Jumpstarts the design phase and provides a working model that business users can understand from day one. We provide Sandbox system for demo and show the standard process to the customer and customer can experience the business what they are doing and what changes are they need along with standard process. which will help to reduce 20% of schedule to spend on workshops to get the details and understand the business then work on WRICEF’s .

Reduces Customization: Focuses teams on value-added enhancements instead of reinventing the wheel. Due to Best practices we will get clear idea on FIT or GAP and use to create incidents in SAP CALM as FIT if we are going with standard else as GAP if we need any changes in the standard process as per the customer need.

Example: In our implementation, using SAP’s pre-configured template processes for Procure-to-Pay and Order-to-Cash cut initial blueprint cycles by 20%. Business users quickly saw real transactions in a sandbox environment, enabling faster sign-offs.

Balancing Standard vs. Custom Enhancements:

Adopt wherever possible: Embrace standard SAP functionality to future-proof your solution and reduce technical debt.

Adapt strategically: When unique business needs arise (legal, compliance, or true differentiators), document and justify each deviation. 

Hold “fit-to-standard” workshops early, where process experts map current business needs to delivered SAP Best Practices. This builds consensus and drives efficiency.

 

2.Effective Global Collaboration with Distributed Teams

Mastering Time Zone & Cultural Challenges. Most global SAP projects involve teams across continents. This brings valuable diversity—but also complexity in coordination.

Overlap Hours: Define cross-time zone collaboration windows for critical discussions and approvals.

Rotation of Meeting Times: Share the burden fairly avoid always favouring one region’s schedule.

Tools for Seamless Execution:

SAP Activate Methodology:  Provides a phase-driven, accelerated path tailored to S/4HANA projects, ensuring structure and clarity.

Jira & MS Teams: Use Jira for agile backlog and sprint management. MS Teams (or similar) enables persistent chat, video calls, and document sharing.

Daily Stand-Ups: Run short, focused scrum calls to synchronize and remove blockers. Conduct weekly call with Customer team to understood both are in same page as per the understanding and involve early customer team into project phase to avoid issue at UAT time and make the development faster and control on what we are doing and how we are doing.

Example: Our distributed team (US, Canada, India) relied on scheduled “power hours” for decisions and escalations. Leveraging MS Teams and SharePoint enabled a central document repository, eliminating version confusion.

 

3.Executing Agile in a Traditionally Waterfall ERP World

Sprints Deliver Early Value. “Big bang” ERP deployments have given way to iterative delivery. Running projects in sprints:

- Enables frequent feedback and reprioritization.

- Uncovers issues early, preventing late-stage surprises.

- Keeps stakeholders engaged and accountable throughout.

 

Example: We structured our workstreams into 4-week sprints: each sprint had clear deliverables (e.g., Design & configuration in sprint 1, WRICEF Developments in Sprint 2, 3 & 4 ), demoed to business users for immediate validation will help in preventing late-stage surprises. 

Aligning Deliverables to Business Value

Sprint Planning: Prioritize features that unblock downstream work or mitigate business risk.

Dual Ownership:  Functional and technical leads co-own stories, promoting end-to-end thinking.

“Show and tell”—Use sprint reviews to demonstrate working configurations, not just status slides.

4.Risk & Quality Management: The Predictability Enablers

 

Proactive Risk Logging and Management. Risks are inevitable. Managing them is non-negotiable.

Risk Register: Maintain a living log of risks (e.g., RAID Risks, Assumptions, Issues, and Dependencies), with mitigations and owners and timelines to resolve.

Frequent Review: Integrate risk discussions into leadership meetings—don’t let issues fester.

Example: A data migration readiness risk (source data inconsistency) was flagged early. By bringing in SAP Data Services experts, we created automated data validation scripts, reducing reconciliation cycles downstream.

Enforcing Quality Gates

SAP Activate Quality Gates:  Map clear checkpoints (e.g. Solution Validation, Readiness) to deliverables, ensuring no phase is closed with critical gaps.

Automated Testing: Deploy test automation for repeated regression and integration tests, saving time before every release.

5.Critical Lessons Learned: What Makes or Breaks Success 

A. Early Stakeholder Alignment is Everything

 

Start with executive buy-in and don’t just communicate changes—co-create solutions. Involve process owners from blueprint to go-live to ensure accountability and adoption. Use proper RACI (Responsible, Accountable, Consulted, and Informed) for all objects so that easy to reach right person and get exact feedback on our developments.

B. Continuous Testing & Automation Reduce Surprises

Start testing early and repeat often. Where possible, introduce automated testing tools to catch defects and speed up cycles.

C. Build a 'Single Team' Mindset

Break down silos between onshore/offshore, business/IT, function/technical. Celebrate joint wins and learn from setbacks together. Shared objectives and rewards help.

 

Conclusion: Turning Challenge into Opportunity

Greenfield S/4HANA Private Cloud implementations are challenging—but they’re also rare, high-impact chances to rethink how your business operates. By anchoring your project in SAP Best Practices, applying agile delivery, and investing in people and governance, you set the stage for not just IT success—but meaningful business transformation.

My Recommendation:

Focus as much on people, process, and partnership as you do on technical configuration. That’s the true recipe for S/4HANA Private Cloud success.

Interested in more SAP transformation stories or have questions? Drop a comment or reach out!
SAP S/4HANA Cloud for enterprise portfolio and project management  SAP Activate

entry.title: Re: Unable to Clear Special G/L Transactions with CME Ind...
entry.content:
Hi @Blas4 ,

Your inability to manually clear special G/L items is confirmed by SAP through the statement “Special G/L items with indicator "S" (issued checks) cannot be cleared manually via Fiori apps in the public cloud”. However, this limitation is also clearly documented in KBA 3552175. Kindly read for more clarifying details.

To clear such items, you post them as part of a supplier down payment request, then clear them using the Clear Incoming Payments or Post Incoming Payments app, specifically using the "Post to G/L Account" tab.

Bulk clearing of "S" items through the Automatic Clearing job is not supported unless processed via the down-payment flow.

If your use case requires handling manual clearance outside of the down-payment context, this falls outside the standard supported processes.

In regards to your question on future planned functionality, the current method remains the only supported path in Public Cloud.  If manual clearing outside this flow is required, it would need to be raised as a customer enhancement request.

Let me know if you’d like help reviewing alternate patterns.

Kind regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAC for planning, SaaS model, Churn Rate KPI
entry.content:
Yes, you can calculate Churn Rate without fixed date attributes by using activity-based logic.

Best Practice:

  • Define the period start as the customer’s first activity date.

  • Consider a customer “lost” if they have no activity for a set period (e.g., 90 days).

  • Mark the last activity as their churn point.

Steps:

  1. Track all customer activity (logins, usage).

  2. Define active customers as those with recent activity (e.g., in the last 30 days).

  3. Flag churned customers if they’ve been inactive beyond your threshold.

  4. Calculate:

    • Customers at Start = Active at beginning of period

    • Lost Customers = Those who became inactive during period

This dynamic model is simple, flexible, and works well for SaaS businesses.

entry.title: Re: SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA – Creating a Fiori tile for ABAP reports
entry.content:
HI @tofo91 @tomiohtonen 

Yes you have understood my meaning correctly! 

I recommend using transaction SE93 because it will make ongoing maintenance and usage tracking easier.   

  • However, direct use of SA38 is fine in a pinch - e.g. for a sandbox system or a quick demo or to check that all features of a custom report work from a web browser. 
  • You may also need to use SA38 to try out a report directly in web browser as a prerequisite to get agreement to create a transaction definition in SE93.
  • SE93 gives you the option of adding an additional authorization object if needed

The authorizations for running reports are exactly the same as in SAP GUI via SAP Logon. There is no compromise on security by using SA38.  An SE93 report transaction simply gives you an additional layer of control if you need it. 

  • You still need to be authorized to run a particular ABAP report to find and run via SA38 e.g. via authorization object S_PROGRAM
  • ABAP report Attributes include an Authorization Group that can be used to refine access via the auth fields in auth object S_PROGRAM, e.g. for sensitive reports, such as those contain personal data 
  • From SA38 you can access all the ABAP reports you are permitted to run.
  • You only need to assign transaction SA38 - that's enough to run reports.

It is NOT best practice to give SE38 to business users - transaction SE38 is for developers only!

entry.title: Re: Transport process of BPA, BAS and IS projects in BTP
entry.content:
Yes, in SAP BTP, it is best practice to have separate subaccounts for Development (DEV), Testing (TEST), and Production (PRD) to ensure environment isolation and control.

To transport your projects:

  • Build Process Automation (BPA): Use the export/import feature or Transport Management Service (TMS).

  • UI5 Applications (Business Application Studio): Deploy to HTML5 repo in DEV, then move using TMS or CI/CD pipeline.

  • Integration Suite iFlows: Export from DEV, import into TEST/PRD, or use TMS/CTS+ for automated transport.

Use SAP Transport Management Service for a scalable and consistent transport setup.

entry.title: Re: Finance Foundation for SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud
entry.content:
Hi DomiK, Probably the data needs to be loaded for Financial Statement version (GL Account Hieratrchy?)

It suggests the package Finance Foundation for SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud uses Replication Flow functionality to load data. It is customer specific, how a Replication Flow will be designed, which CDS views should be replicated in one Replication Flow and which data should be replicated with a delta or which with the full upload option. Because of this, the Replication Flows are not delivered as content as part of above package. Depending on your specific needs, please create your own Replication Flows to replicated data into the inbound layer of each content package. For each content package, it is documented which CDS views have to be replicated and which are the corresponding local tables.

Please refer this - Replication Flows | SAP Help Portal

As an alternative - can you try manually maintaining data in Datasphere Tables? if that is an option?

Cheers, Abhi

entry.title: Re: Down Payment with partial deliveries
entry.content:
Yes that statement is misleading but wanted to mention that you create a dummy item in the sales order with item category set to billing relevance I. This item holds the billing plan for the down payment. The actual deliverable items use item category with billing relevance A for delivery-based invoicing. This way, you isolate the down payment logic from the delivery-based items.

The other option is apply the billing plan at the sales order header, keep item categories as delivery-based. SAP will still allow down payment processing via the header billing plan, while invoicing is triggered by deliveries. Not sure on the outcome and you need to test it thoroughly

If both the above options are not feasible / working, then, you need to go with custom validation and it involves more effort and complexity is involved but allows full flexibility.

entry.title: Navigating the New Milestone in Continuous Delivery of Regulatory Content
entry.content:
July 31st marks the latest Public Cloud Release for SAP S/4HANA for product compliance. Over the next weeks, we will look at new features and how they can used for your benefit. First is continuous delivery of regulatory content which has hit another milestone with the inclusion of safety data sheet management and authoring and product marketability compliance requirements.

How does this happen? First is the exchange format which has an entire compliance requirement included. Info included is ID, CR Pattern, URL, name of the compliance regulation, affected applications (like waste, radioactive), applicability area, issuing organization.

Next, well you have 2 options, the content comes with the newest release via our MIME repository, via the backend system using transaction se80. Zip files (which are moved manually from the MIME repository into the database tables) are created for each compliance requirement, under Product Compliance and then the area you want to update, for example Product Marketability. You can access and download the corresponding files to update your system. But these files are only updated when there is a new release.

Option 2 is our Regulatory Content Service which you can access in the Developer Hub and currently there are 4 APIs you can set up to deliver content to your system:

  • Compliance Requirements
  • Phrases
  • Graphics
  • Listed Substance Content

 

Once setup, a Job is scheduled, it will pull new or updated content into your system with no additional work. There is a Display Log to view what has been happening, for on-premise customers, this needs to be set up by an administrator. While this system does deliver content directly to your system, it doesn’t activate it, the user must do this in the Activate app which exist for Product Marketability, Safety Data Sheets and Dangerous Goods. One final note, to setup the Content Service, Public Cloud customers need to check out SAP Note 2999140 and Private Cloud and On-Premise customers SAP Note 3055767.

For more information on this and other topics we covered, here are some links to helpful documentation.

Regulatory Content Service Documentation

Product Marketability and Chemical Compliance Content Update   What's New content topic

Dangerous Goods Management Content Update   What's New content topic

Safety Data Sheet Management, Authoring and Occupational Exposure Limits Content  What's New content topic

SAP Content for Product Compliance  Documentation for all content types delivered by SAP

entry.title: Re: How can I update a delivery document after adding ite...
entry.content:
Routine 201 allows manual addition of items in the delivery that are not referenced from the sales order. Check for your delivery type configuration, what routine is there. But before adding a new line item in delivery, you need to take into consideration the impact due to this. The manually added item may not carry pricing from the sales order. If Pricing Type D is used in copy control (VTFL), the price may default to zero in the billing document. You may need to manually update pricing or use Pricing Type B or C to redetermine conditions.

The item won’t have a reference to the original sales order, which can affect Credit checks, ATP, Revenue recognition, Reporting and analytics

entry.title: SAP Master Data Integration (MDI) meets SAP Advanced Event Mesh (AEM)
entry.content:
In the ever-growing landscape of SAP BTP and modular cloud architecture, seamless integration between services is more important than ever. One powerful combination that's gaining traction is SAP Master Data Integration (MDI) working in tandem with SAP Advanced Event Mesh (AEM). The foundation for MDI is the One Domain Model (ODM) – a standardized data model. In this blog post, we’ll walk you through the setup to connect MDI with AEM and enable real-time event-driven integration for your master data.

Let’s dive into what makes this integration so valuable — and how you can get started.

🌐Why Combine MDI and AEM?

  • SAP MDI ensures consistent and harmonized master data across SAP applications and services, based on Data Replication Framework Technology (DRF).
  • SAP ODM It is a standardized domain model to unify and harmonize business objects like Customer, Product, Supplier, etc.) across SAP’s cloud solutions
  • SAP AEM provides a high-performance event broker that allows for reliable and scalable event distribution across systems.

Bringing these together enables:

  • Configure only
  • Real-time data propagation of master data via events
  • Decoupled and scalable architecture
  • Simplified integration for consuming systems in SAP but also NON-SAP applications

MDI Content: https://api.sap.com/package/sap-mdi-masterDataIntegration/rest

 

🛠️ Prerequisites

Before we get into the setup, make sure you have the following:

  • An instance of SAP Advanced Event Mesh (AEM) created and available, I do not show this in this blog
  • An instance of SAP Master Data Integration (MDI), which is one focus of this blog
  • An instance of SAP Integration Suite, Cloud Integration, which is one focus of this blog
  • Connectivity setup between MDI and the involved SAP components, which is one focus of this blog

 

🔧Setup Steps

1. Create Master Data Integration (MDI) service

Assign s4hana-onpremise service plan. For our setup we are using a S/4HANA OnPremise system, in case you have a S/4HANA Cloud system choose another service Plan Create an Instance for Master Data Integration and create a ServiceKey for connection setup,

 

  • Create Distribution Model (sap.help.com)

Select the Provide and Consumer fro your scenario and the ODM object you would like to replicate, for this blog we have used the latest version of CostCenter. Save nad active the Distribution Model.

The MDI setup has been completed.

2. Enable your SAP Backend for MDI

·      Establishing oAuth Profile for Outbound Connection to SAP Master Data Integration via SAP transaction oa2c_config

·      Creating Destination to MDI  via SAP transaction SM59 while using the oAuth profile

·      Configuring to Destination for Connecting to SAP Master Data Integration via SAP transaction S_SAL_71000052

·      Defining BGRFC Destinations via SAP transaction sbgrfcconf

·      Extracting AIF Content via SAP transcation /AIF/CONTENT_EXTRACT

·      Publishing ODATA V4 Service Groups via /IWFND/V4_ADMIN

The SAP S/4HANA setup and underlying connection setup between SAP and MDI has been completed. The screenshot above shows the AIF Monitor to the master data exchange between both components.

3. Enable your SAP Integration Suite 

For the setup we will combine two adapters of the Integration Suite.

To read the master data from MDI we have used SAP Master Data Integration Receiver Adapter which will be trigged via scheduler. 

To provide the master data event to SAP AEM we have use the SAP AEM adapter and connected it to a queue. Another valid approach could be to throw a topic.
The Cloud Integration setup has been completed.

4. Test the End-to-End Flow

  • Create or update a master data record (e.g., Cost Center) in the source system connected to MDI ( e.g. transaction KS02)
  • Cost Center should be available in MDI (check e.g. in CALM)
  • MDI publishes the dataset to the Integration Suite
  • AEM broker receives in the defined queue and processes the master data event according to the subscription setup 
  • Check logs or dashboards to confirm message delivery.

For this blog I simply checked the queue insights view of my used broker and the SAP AEM TryMe feature. The master data event has been received and is ready for distribution/subscription. 

 

 Can MDI Directly Publish to AEM?

SAP Master Data Integration currently emits events not directly to SAP Advanced Event Mesh (AEM). MDI uses could use Integration Suite, Cloud Integration through BTP’s managed messaging infrastructure.

As of mid-2025, there’s:

  • No native support to configure MDI to push events directly to AEM

No configuration options in the MDI UI to define AEM as the event target

✅ Conclusion

Integrating SAP Master Data Integration with SAP Advanced Event Mesh is a powerful way to enable real-time, event-driven architectures across your SAP landscape. It decouples systems, ensures scalability, and improves responsiveness in your integrations.

Whether you're syncing business partner data across applications or building modular apps that respond to master data changes, this combo of MDI + AEM provides the reliability and flexibility you need.

Be aware that we are currently preparing some more technical blogs explaing the setup of DRF+AIF and DRF+RAP without using MDI

Have you tried integrating MDI with AEM? Share your use cases and challenges in the comments!

entry.title: Re: Unable to post 545 for by products via WHSCON idoc
entry.content:
WHSCON IDocs require proper batch split handling for by-products. Ensure that the E1EDL19 segment in the IDoc uses the ‘BAS’ qualifier for batch split items. The by-product must be reported as a new item, not as part of the original delivery item.

The error implies that the system expects 57,000 CAR of material 10035244 to be confirmed. If the IDoc doesn’t confirm the full quantity or splits it incorrectly, the system flags it as “open.” Check if the E1EDL24-LFIMG field (confirmed quantity) matches the expected value.

entry.title: Re: Double authorization while creating a sales order
entry.content:
Thank you for your question.

Best practice for your eCommerce solution with SAP digital payments add-on and SAP S/4HANA is to use one of the two APIs for Sales Order Management:
Sales Order (A2X) - S/4HANA Private Cloud and On-Premise
Sales Order (A2A) - S/4HANA Private Cloud and On-Premise

The same exists for S/4HANA Public Cloud:
Sales Order (A2X) - S/4HANA Public Cloud
Sales Order (A2A) - S/4HANA Public Cloud 

Scrolling down to the examples shows that in your use-case only the SAP Digital Payments card token and SAP Digital Payments authorization number is necessary to pass as payment plan item parameters.

"to_PaymentPlanItemDetails":[
{ "EPaytByDigitalPaymentSrvc"      : "token1",
  "AuthorizationByDigitalPaytSrvc" : "auth1"
  }]

 

The usage of iDocs is not supported automatically. That's why you are facing your mentioned issue.
But there are customers that were able to use the iDoc to map the SAP Digital Payments parameters into their S/4HANA and creating the card and authorization data properly in the underlying Sales Order.

I hope that helps!

entry.title: Re: Decimal Notation conversion as per user setting
entry.content:
There is a bug in the FORM change_quantity. 
Eg: Please refer the below test scenario.

Results:

Therefore, the corrected one:
The below code will work for user selected decimal format on the selection screen. 

*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Form f_change_value
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Change values based on user selected decimal format
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& -->  p1        text
*& <--  p2        text
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM f_change_value USING u_delimiter TYPE c
                          u_separator TYPE c
                 CHANGING c_sample_value ##PERF_NO_TYPE.

  TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_number,
           text(30) TYPE c,
         END OF ty_number.

  DATA: lv_whole(30)         TYPE c,
        lv_decimal(30)       TYPE c,
        lv_strlen            TYPE i,
        lv_ndiv              TYPE i,
        lv_nmod              TYPE i,
        lv_flag              TYPE c,
        lv_temp              TYPE i,
        lv_previous_text(30) TYPE c,
        ls_number            TYPE ty_number,
        lt_number            TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_number.


  CLEAR: lt_number, ls_number, lv_temp, lv_flag, lv_previous_text, lv_whole, lv_decimal, lv_strlen, lv_ndiv, lv_nmod.

  SPLIT c_sample_value AT '.' INTO lv_whole
                                   lv_decimal.
  "Get value length without decimals
  lv_strlen = strlen( lv_whole ).
  "Divide length and get quotient
  lv_ndiv   = lv_strlen DIV 3.
  "Get remainder for length
  lv_nmod   = lv_strlen MOD 3.

  "Get remainder value length of first set of digits into table.
  IF lv_nmod IS NOT INITIAL.
    ls_number-text = lv_whole(lv_nmod).
    lv_temp = lv_nmod.
    APPEND ls_number TO lt_number.
    CLEAR: ls_number.
  ENDIF.

  "Do quotient number of times and append the 3 set digits into table.
  DO lv_ndiv TIMES.
    ls_number-text = lv_whole+lv_temp(3).
    lv_temp = lv_temp + 3.
    APPEND ls_number TO lt_number.
    CLEAR: ls_number.
  ENDDO.
  CLEAR: lv_whole.

  LOOP AT lt_number ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_number>).
    IF lv_flag IS INITIAL.
      "Assign first set of digits into variable
     lv_whole = <fs_number>-text.
      "remove spaces
      CONDENSE lv_whole NO-GAPS.
      lv_previous_text = lv_whole.
      lv_flag = abap_true.
    ELSE.
      "concatenate remaining 3 set digits
      CONCATENATE lv_previous_text <fs_number>-text INTO lv_whole
                                          SEPARATED BY u_delimiter.
      lv_previous_text = lv_whole.
    ENDIF.
    c_sample_value = lv_whole.
  ENDLOOP.
  IF lv_decimal IS NOT INITIAL.
    CONCATENATE c_sample_value lv_decimal INTO c_sample_value
                                  SEPARATED BY u_separator.
  ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

entry.title: Highlights of the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release
entry.content:
Welcome to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release! The next release to help businesses unlock agility, intelligence, and resilience through Cloud ERP.

If you prefer watching rather than reading, you are welcome to check out my product update video, where I guide you through the content with my virtual twin.  

 

Figure 1: Check out my top highlights of the release in this video. 

The evolution of business capabilities via SAP Business AI will be a significant part of my personal release highlights. The arrival of SAP BDC, our Business Data Cloud (BDC) within our flagship ERP product SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition marks another highlight and brings the SAP flywheel to life.

And to be honest, I am particularly proud of the extensions we are now providing, built on the three-system landscape architecture, as the demand for more localizations have been articulated by many customers.

Over the years, we witnessed steady, linear growth that reflected our commitment to consistency and quality and a growing business scope. The new system architecture allowed us to enhance the scalability and flexibility for our customers, making it more adaptable. This shift was more than just a technical upgrade; it represented a transformation in the way our customers could approach own developments, deployment, and expansion and allowed our customers to better meet the needs of a growing user base and last-mile-individualization demand.  Building on this architecture, we now add new capabilities step-by-step.

 

Configuration localization tool now generally available

We are happy to announce the general availability of the configuration localization tool. This feature embedded in SAP Central Business Configuration is designed to streamline the creation of tailored customer local versions for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for around further 160 countries and regions on top of the 60 standard local versions.

This tool is easy to use, empowering partners and customers to create new local versions efficiently. It provides localized configuration for a selected target country or region based on the settings of a source country or region - currently Germany.  This tool ensures localized configurations are generated consistently and life cycle compliant, a further project using available extensibility options can adopt to specific demands.

Figure 2: System screenshot

 

 

 

 

 

 

For further reference, you are welcome to check out my blog post on parallel line as the next evolution of our public cloud ERP product journey.

 

Figure 3: Demo video

 

 

 

 

 

The general availability of the configuration localization tool opens the door for businesses to quickly and reliably expand into new markets with consistent configuration standards and tailored business processes.

Before we jointly investigate extended business capabilities, let’s explore, how SAP’s flywheel, combining fully integrated cloud applications, mission-critical data, and embedded AI, equipping enterprises to respond to macro-economic volatility, is coming to life.

 

BDC integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and initial list of data products

SAP S/4HANA Cloud PCE now supports Business Data Cloud (BDC) integration, offering a robust and scalable framework that enables seamless data exchange between SAP systems and external platforms. The solution is designed to unlock new levels of operational efficiency, agility, and insight across the enterprise.

BDC integration allows organizations to establish reliable connections between SAP S/4HANA Cloud PCE and a variety of external systems and databases. By automating the flow of data across these environments, companies can significantly reduce manual effort, minimize the risk of error, and shift their focus from routine maintenance to strategic action. The result is a more connected enterprise build on advanced analytics and processing capabilities, while maintaining the flexibility to work with a broader digital ecosystem.

At the core of this integration lies a rich and growing suite of data products, with an initial offering of approximately 36 available for use across departments and industries. These include financial accounting data that covers general ledger entries, accounts receivable and payable, and bank statements; sales and distribution data to improve order management and fulfillment; and material management data that supports real-time inventory control and procurement decisions. The human resources data offering helps manage employee information and recruiting metrics, while Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Insights allow organizations to better understand and serve their customers.

Additionally, businesses can leverage SAP Ariba Supplier Management profiles to strengthen vendor relationships, production planning records to enhance manufacturing efficiency, and retail and logistics analytics to refine distribution strategies. Project management metrics offer greater visibility into timelines, budgets, and outcomes, while compliance and audit reports help organizations stay proactive in meeting regulatory standards.

These data products collectively form a foundational layer for a next level of transformation. By combining them with BDC integration, organizations gain the ability to select and customize the data flows that are most relevant to their specific goals and processes and future-proof their operations via a truly connected, insight-driven enterprise. You will find more information here. 

 

What is on top of my business feature and AI list?

Simplify asset accounting

In the Finance domain, we’re elevating the user experience with AI-powered innovations that reshape how fixed asset data is interpreted and managed. A standout feature of this release is the introduction of AI-generated explanations for fixed asset key figures.

These insights, delivered in natural language, help users clearly understand the origins and calculations behind critical values such as depreciation and net book value. This capability simplifies interpretation, allowing users to grasp financial figures and value changes more quickly, which enhances productivity and reduces the time required for recurring financial tasks.

Additionally, we've already delivered AI-assisted asset master data creation, allowing users to enter data using simple conversational commands. This reduces the effort and time required for data entry and onboarding, while improving accuracy and data governance through intuitive, user-friendly interfaces.

Get more details here.

Figure 4: AI-assisted explanation of fixed asset key figures

 

 

 

 

 

SAP Business AI is central to these improvements, providing detailed explanations and support that facilitate better decision-making and enhance user satisfaction.

This release aligns with SAP's commitment to delivering efficient and user-centric solutions in asset accounting.

 

AI-assisted processing of incoming quality certificates with SAP Document AI

With the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, we are introducing an innovation that brings generative AI directly into the core of quality management: SAP Document AI. This powerful, AI-driven feature automates and streamlines the handling of incoming quality certificates, unlocking efficiency gains for our customers.

SAP Document AI accelerates the processing of supplier quality certificates by extracting relevant information from documents—whether paper or digital—and seamlessly integrating it into SAP workflows. This innovation reduces manual effort, shortens processing times, and lowers the risk of human error. Quality technicians are freed from repetitive tasks, allowing them to focus on more strategic and value-adding activities. As a result, companies can release stock faster, reduce inspection-related production delays, and achieve overall improvements in throughput.

Accuracy and reliability are also improved. By automatically matching certificates with system records and updating their status, SAP Document AI ensures that no document goes missing and that compliance is upheld throughout the process. Intelligent error handling provides added resilience and trust in the system.

One of the most powerful aspects of this solution is its seamless integration into the SAP S/4HANA Cloud experience. Delivered as a ready-to-use capability, SAP Document AI requires no custom development, offering customers an immediate path to value and a faster return on investment.

Figure 5: Quality management AI certificate

 

 

 

 

 

As we continue to embed AI, data, and automation into the fabric of our ERP offering, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition stands as a foundation for smarter, more agile operations. The introduction of SAP Document AI is just one example of how we are helping our customers future-proof their business, drive continuous improvement, and lead with innovation.

 

Beta: AI-assisted smart solution for situations

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release brings a new dimension of intelligence to the user experience with the introduction of the AI-assisted smart solution for situations in My Home. Currently available in beta testing, this innovative feature simplifies the resolution of business-critical situations by dynamically guiding users through resolution steps, reducing complexity, and improving the quality of decision-making. The context-aware recommendations and outcomes that are both trustworthy and relevant.

This smart solution leverages generative AI to adapt the user interface in real time, presenting timely insights and suggested actions tailored to the specific business context. Designed to support fast, informed decisions, it transforms traditionally manual and multi-step tasks into a seamless, click-efficient experience.

Le’s make it tangible: In a classical ERP environment, a sales representative receives a notification for a sales quotation to expire soon. In a conventional workflow, the user would open the situation, navigate to the quotation, manually edit the details, save the changes, and then return to resolve the situation. With the AI-assisted solution, these steps are consolidated into a single, streamlined flow—demonstrating how user effort is minimized while responsiveness is maximized. Watch the example in this video.

Accessible from the SAP S/4HANA Cloud homepage, the solution enables situation handling in just a few clicks, a dynamic cards concept brings key information and associated actions together.

Join the SAP beta testing for the latest AI-assisted user experience features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. For more details, visit the Get Involved Early page to register and contribute to the evolving landscape of AI-driven business processes. 

SAP S/4HANA Cloud now supports Business Data Cloud (BDC) integration, offering a robust and scalable framework that enables seamless data exchange between SAP systems and external platforms. This integration is designed to unlock new levels of operational efficiency, agility, and insight across the enterprise.

As companies look to future-proof their operations, the integration of Business Data Cloud with SAP S/4HANA Cloud offers a powerful opportunity to move toward a truly connected, insight-driven enterprise. With this innovation, SAP continues to support customers in building intelligent, resilient, and agile business models.

 

SAP Activate innovations

Also, our agile activation methodology, SAP Activate, receives further improvements in both, the content and user experience—making project execution more intelligent and accessible.

With this release, Joule capabilities are now live in the SAP Activate road map viewer for all users, starting with the SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Cloud ERP Private implementation road maps.

Joule brings AI-assisted support directly into the project guidance experience, helping users find the right assets faster and navigate complex tasks more intuitively. Additional content will be added in the coming weeks, expanding Joule’s reach to even more road maps. Learn more in this blog post by Chandan Gurav.

To further streamline onboarding, we’ve also refreshed the initial experience in the SAP Activate road map viewer. A new visual design, guided entry points, and onboarding assets built into the home screen help new users get started with greater ease. For more details on this improved experience, see this blog post by Ana Goetze.

Lastly, we’ve launched a dedicated provisioning road map for SAP Business Suite packages, now available in the road map viewer. This new asset provides targeted guidance to support a smooth setup experience. You can explore the details in this blog post by Adnette Kamugisha.

These updates mark an important step in delivering a more intelligent and user-friendly implementation experience—designed to support customers and partners from day one.

 

GenAI-driven extensibility assistant

With the 2508 release, the introduction of the genAI-driven extensibility assistant marks a significant evolution in how custom fields and business logic are managed. By embedding generative AI into the extensibility framework, the process of adapting the system becomes faster, more intuitive, and more transparent.

The assistant simplifies the creation of custom fields, allowing organizations to respond to evolving requirements with agility and precision. This removes the dependency on complex development tasks and enables quicker adaptations to support new data capture and reporting needs. AI also supports the discovery of relevant business contexts, helping to align custom fields with underlying business processes from the outset, improving consistency and relevance in system behavior as changes are introduced.

Transparency is further enhanced through intelligent usage analysis. Understanding where specific fields or logic are deployed across the system supports better governance and more efficient change management. This visibility is essential for maintaining control over system customizations while enabling ongoing innovation.

To support accurate and efficient data entry, the assistant also helps identify relevant value help views. This improves user interactions and contributes to high-quality data standards across the system. For more advanced extensibility scenarios, the assistant streamlines the activation of business scenarios with context-aware recommendations. Configurations can be fine-tuned to operational needs with greater confidence and less manual effort.

Furthermore, the GenAI-driven assistant aids in locating the appropriate Business Add-In (BAdI) for specific use cases. This ensures that enhancements are both technically sound and aligned with system architecture best practices—delivering functional flexibility without compromising system integrity.

Figure 6: Extensibility Assistant

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

My summary

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release delivers tons of innovations, across platform, extension concepts, business feature and SAP Business AI. From finance and quality management to global rollout capabilities. Pick what you like and let me know what your personal highlights are.

I invite you to explore the deeper business and industry-specific innovations in the upcoming blogs. Be sure to visit our community page to connect with our team of experts, ask your questions, and share your feedback.

Follow the PSCC_Enablement tag to stay current with future updates.

Feel free to follow me at BeSchulze in the community and on LinkedIn to not miss any updates. 

Let’s keep advancing together—towards a smarter, more connected ERP future.

Yours,

Bert

entry.title: Re: Amazon Punchout integration with SAP S/4HANA Public C...
entry.content:
Hi @aman_mittal,

Thank you for your question.

Below are my confirmations based on SAP’s official documentation for SAP S/4HANA Public Clou Edition:

  • S/4 Cloud does not maintain supplier catalogs internally. Punch-out catalog experiences rely on external supplier punch-out (OCI or cXML) via SAP Business Network or supplier websites. See Sourcing & Procurement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2502 for further information.
  • SAP currently supports punch-outs primarily through SAP Ariba Buying for example, for major catalogs integrated with Business Network.
  • There is no SAP-delivered integration or setup guide specifically for Amazon PunchOut and S/4HANA Public Cloud via CPI.
  • If you have an Amazon-provided guide, it may need custom translation via CPI or middleware to convert into OCI/cXML messages accepted by S/4HANA Cloud.

I hope this provides more clarity on the available possibilities.

 

Best regards

Chris
